title: Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
description: Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
OB: The problem is that the BidiUtil class in the org.eclipse.swt.internal package uses the Class.forName() method, specifically in the line: static Callback callback = new Callback (BidiUtil.class, "windowProc", 4). This usage of Class.forName("org...BidiUtil") may cause a NoClassDefFoundError, which is not defined in the CLDC class libraries. This issue is only visible when using jxeLink or a similar tool, as the compiler automatically assumes that NoClassDefFoundError is available.
EB: To resolve this issue, the line above should be changed to: static Callback callback = new Callback (new BidiUtil().getClass(), "windowProc", 4). This change eliminates the use of reflection and should have the same effect as before.
SR: To reproduce the issue, verify or use jxeLink with the existing code, and observe the NoClassDefFoundError. After making the suggested change, test the code again to ensure that the issue no longer occurs.
